children.name: Number of Publicly Owned Airports
children.definition: The number of airports designated for public use that are located in the county.

children.name: Number of Privately Owned Airports
children.definition: The number of airports designated for private use that are located in the county.

children.name: Number of Military Owned Airports
children.definition: The number of airports designated for military use that are located in the county.

children.name: Bridges
children.source: Federal Highway Administration - National Bridge Inventory

children.name: All Bridges - Total Bridges
children.definition: Total number of bridges located in the county.

children.name: All Bridges - City/Town Owned
children.definition: Total number of bridges owned by a Town or Township Highway Agency or a City or Municipal Highway Agency.

children.name: All Bridges - County Owned
children.definition: Total number of bridges owned by a County Highway Agency.

children.name: All Bridges - Federal Owned
children.definition: Total number of bridges owned by a Federal Agency. Includes the Indian Tribal Government, Bureau of Indian Affairs, Bureau of Fish and Wildlife, U.S. Forest Service, National Park Service, Tennessee Valley Authority, Bureau of Land Management, Bureau of Reclamation, Corps of Engineers, Air Force, Navy/Marines, Army, NASA, or the Metropolitan Washington Airports Service.

children.name: All Bridges - Privately Owned
children.definition: Total number of bridges owned by a Private agency.

children.name: All Bridges - State Owned
children.definition: Total number of bridges owned by a State Highway Agency, a State Park, Forest, or Reservation Agency, or Other State Agencies.

children.name: All Bridges - Local Owned
children.definition: Total number of bridges owned by a Local Park, Forest, or Reservation Agency or Local Toll Authority, or Other Local Agencies.

children.name: Structurally Deficient Bridges - Total Bridges
children.definition: Total number of structurally deficient bridges; A highway bridge is classified as structurally deficient if the deck, superstructure, substructure, or culvert is rated in 'poor' condition (0 to 4 on the NBI rating scale). A bridge can also be classified as structurally deficient if its load carrying capacity is significantly below current design standards or if a waterway below frequently overtops the bridge during floods.

children.name: Structurally Deficient Bridges - City/Town Owned
children.definition: Total number of structurally deficient bridges owned by a Town or Township Highway Agency or a City or Municipal Highway Agency.

children.name: Structurally Deficient Bridges - County Owned
children.definition: Total number of structurally deficient bridges owned by a County Highway Agency.

children.name: Structurally Deficient Bridges - Federal Owned
children.definition: Total number of structurally deficient bridges owned by a Federal Agency. Includes the Indian Tribal Government, Bureau of Indian Affairs, Bureau of Fish and Wildlife, U.S. Forest Service, National Park Service, Tennessee Valley Authority, Bureau of Land Management, Bureau of Reclamation, Corps of Engineers, Air Force, Navy/Marines, Army, NASA, or the Metropolitan Washington Airports Service.

children.name: Structurally Deficient Bridges - Privately Owned
children.definition: Total number of structurally deficient bridges owned by a Private agency.

children.name: Structurally Deficient Bridges - State Owned
children.definition: Total number of structurally deficient bridges owned by a State Highway Agency, a State Park, Forest, or Reservation Agency, or Other State Agencies.

children.name: Structurally Deficient Bridges - Local Owned
children.definition: Total number of structurally deficient bridges owned by a Local Park, Forest, or Reservation Agency or Local Toll Authority, or Other Local Agencies.

children.name: Functionally Obsolete Bridges - Total Bridges
children.definition: Total number of functionally obsolete bridges; 'Functionally obsolete' means that the design of a bridge is not suitable for its current use, such as lack of safety shoulders or the inability to handle current traffic volume, speed, size, or weight.

children.name: Functionally Obsolete Bridges - City/Town Owned
children.definition: Total number of functionally obsolete bridges owned by a Town or Township Highway Agency or a City or Municipal Highway Agency.

children.name: Functionally Obsolete Bridges - County Owned
children.definition: Total number of functionally obsolete bridges owned by a County Highway Agency.

children.name: Functionally Obsolete Bridges - Federal Owned
children.definition: Total number of functionally obsolete bridges owned by a Federal Agency. Includes the Indian Tribal Government, Bureau of Indian Affairs, Bureau of Fish and Wildlife, U.S. Forest Service, National Park Service, Tennessee Valley Authority, Bureau of Land Management, Bureau of Reclamation, Corps of Engineers, Air Force, Navy/Marines, Army, NASA, or the Metropolitan Washington Airports Service.

children.name: Functionally Obsolete Bridges - Privately Owned
children.definition: Total number of functionally obsolete bridges owned by a Private agency.

children.name: Functionally Obsolete Bridges - State Owned
children.definition: Total number of functionally obsolete bridges owned by a State Highway Agency, a State Park, Forest, or Reservation Agency, or Other State Agencies.

children.name: Functionally Obsolete Bridges - Local Owned
children.definition: Total number of functionally obsolete bridges owned by a Local Park, Forest, or Reservation Agency or Local Toll Authority, or Other Local Agencies.

children.name: Road Classification
children.source: Federal Highway Administration - Highway Performance Monitoring System

children.name: Total Public Road Miles
children.definition: Total miles of public roads, which are any roads or streets owned and maintained by a public authority and open to public travel.

children.name: Interstate Road Miles
children.definition: Total miles of interstate highway, defined as a divided arterial highway for through traffic with full or partial control of access and grade separations at major intersections

children.name: Other Freeway/Expressway Road Miles
children.definition: Total miles of other freeway and expressway, defined as all urban principal arterials with limited access but not part of the Interstate system.

children.name: Other Principle Arterial Road Miles
children.definition: Total miles of other principle arterial roads, defined as major streets or highways, many of multi-lane or freeway design, serving high-volume traffic corridor movements that connect major generators of travel.

children.name: Minor Arterial Road Miles
children.definition: Total miles of minor arterial roads, defined as roads linking cities and larger towns in rural areas. In urban areas, roads that link but do not penetrate neighborhoods within a community.

children.name: Major Collector Road Miles
children.definition: Total miles of major collector roads, defined as routes that serve intracounty rather than statewide travel.

children.name: Urban Minor Collector Road Miles
children.definition: Total miles of urban minor collector roads, defined as streets that provide direct access to neighborhoods and arterials.

children.name: Local Road Miles
children.definition: Total miles of local roads, defined as roads intended solely for access to adjacent properties.

children.name: Share Interstate
children.definition: Percentage of interstate road miles out of total public road miles.

children.name: Share Other Freeway/Expressway
children.definition: Percentage of other freeway and expressway road miles out of total public road miles.

children.name: Share Other Principle Arterial
children.definition: Percentage of other principle arterial road miles out of total public road miles.

children.name: Share Minor Arterial
children.definition: Percentage of minor arterial road miles out of total public road miles.

children.name: Share Major Collector
children.definition: Percentage of major collector road miles out of total public road miles.

children.name: Share Urban Minor Collector
children.definition: Percentage of urban minor collector road miles out of total public road miles.

children.name: Share Local
children.definition: Percentage of local road miles out of total public road miles.

children.name: Road Ownership
children.source: Federal Highway Administration - Highway Performance Monitoring System
U.S. Department of Transportation – Federal Highway Administration, Highway Performance Monitoring System

children.name: Total Public Road Miles
children.definition: Total miles of public roads, which are any roads or streets owned and maintained by a public authority and open to public travel.

children.name: State Highway Agency Road Miles
children.definition: Public road miles that are under the control of a state highway agency.

children.name: County Highway Agency Road Miles
children.definition: Public road miles under the control of the county plus city or municipality for consolidated governments.

children.name: Other State Agency Road Miles
children.definition: Public road miles under the control of another state agency.

children.name: Other Local Agency Road Miles
children.definition: Public road miles under the control of another local agency.

children.name: Privately Owned Road Miles
children.definition: Public road miles under the control of private agency.

children.name: Town or Township Highway Agency Road Miles
children.definition: Public road miles under the control of a town or township highway agency.

children.name: City or Municipal Highway Agency Road Miles
children.definition: Public road miles under the control of a municipal highway agency.

children.name: Other Public Instrumentality Road Miles
children.definition: Public road miles under the control of other public instrumentality.

children.name: Indian Tribe/Nation Road Miles
children.definition: Public road miles under the control of Indian Tribe/Nation/Government.

children.name: Federal Agency Road Miles
children.definition: Public road miles under the control of the federal highway administration.

children.name: County Land Square Miles
children.definition: Total land area within the county’s geographical boundaries.

children.name: Total Road Miles per Square Mile
children.definition: Total public road miles per square mile of county land area.

children.name: Total County Road Miles per Square Mile
children.definition: Total public road miles under the control of the county plus city or municipality for consolidated governments per square mile of the county land area.

children.name: Unknown Road Miles
children.definition: Public road miles under the control of any other agency.

children.name: Share State Highway Agency
children.definition: Percentage public road miles that are under the control of a state highway agency out of all public roads.

children.name: Share County Highway Agency
children.definition: Percentage public road miles under the control of the county plus city or municipality for consolidated governments out of all public roads.

children.name: Share Other State Agencies
children.definition: Percentage public road miles under the control of another state agency out of all public roads.

children.name: Share Other Local Agencies
children.definition: Percentage public road miles under the control of another local agency out of all public roads.

children.name: Share Private
children.definition: Percentage public road miles under the control of private agency out of all public roads.

children.name: Share Town or Township Highway Agency
children.definition: Percentage public road miles under the control of a town or township highway agency out of all public roads.

children.name: Share City or Municipal Highway Agency
children.definition: Percentage public road miles under the control of a municipal highway agency out of all public roads.

children.name: Share Other Public Instrumentality
children.definition: Percentage public road miles under the control of other public instrumentality out of all public roads.

children.name: Share Indian Tribe/Nation
children.definition: Percentage public road miles under the control of Indian Tribe/Nation/Government out of all public roads.

children.name: Share Federal Agency
children.definition: Percentage public road miles under the control of the federal highway administration out of all public roads.

children.name: Share Unknown
children.definition: Percentage public road miles under the control of any other agency out of all public roads.

children.name: Utility Employment
children.source: U.S. Census Bureau - Census of Individual Governments: Employment

children.name: Total
children.definition: The number of Full-time equivalent (FTE) employees for each county is a computed statistic representing the number of full-time employees that could have been employed if the reported number of hours worked by part-time employees had been worked by full-time employees.

children.name: Total Utility
children.definition: Number of FTEs working on Electricity Utilities and Gas Utilities.

children.name: Electric Utilities
children.definition: Number of FTEs working on Operation, maintenance, and construction of public electric power systems, including production, acquisition, and distribution of electricity to general public or to other public or private utilities.

children.name: Gas Utilities
children.definition: Number of FTEs working on Operation, maintenance, and construction of public natural gas supply systems, including production, acquisition, and distribution of gas to general public or to other public or private utilities. This function covers government gas supply activities for residential, commercial, and industrial gas usage.

children.name: Utility Revenue
children.source: U.S. Census Bureau - Census of Individual Governments: Finance

children.name: Total
children.definition: All amounts of money received by a government from external sources--net of refunds and other correcting transactions--other than from issuance of debt, liquidation of investments, and as agency and private trust transactions. Note that revenue excludes noncash transactions such as receipt of services, commodities, or other 'receipts in kind.'

children.name: Total Utility
children.definition: Total amount of utility revenue, including Electric Power Systems, Gas Supply Systems, Public Mass Transit Systems and Water Supply Systems.

children.name: Electric Power Systems
children.definition: State aid for maintenance, operation, and construction of public electric power generating plants and related transmission systems.

children.name: Gas Supply Systems
children.definition: State aid for maintenance, operation, and construction of public natural gas supply and distribution systems.

children.name: Public Mass Transit Systems
children.definition: State aid for maintenance, operation, and construction of public mass transit systems (buses, subways, commuter railroads, urban mass transit, and the like).

children.name: Water Supply Systems
children.definition: State aid for maintenance, operation, and construction of public water supply systems, water purification plants, etc.

children.name: Utility Expenditures
children.source: U.S. Census Bureau - Census of Individual Governments: Finance

children.name: Total
children.definition: All amounts of money paid out by a government--net of recoveries and other correcting transactions--other than for retirement of debt, investment in securities, extension of credit, or as agency transactions. Note that expenditure includes only external transactions of a government and excludes non-cash transactions such as the provision of perquisites or other payments in kind.

children.name: Total Utility
children.definition: Total amount of utility expenditures, including Electric Utilities, Gas Utilities, Current Operations, Construction, Other Capital Outlay, Interests on Debt, Intergovernmental to State and Intergovernmental to Local.

children.name: Electric Utilities
children.definition: Operation, maintenance, and construction of public electric power systems, including production, acquisition, and distribution of electricity to general public or to other public or private utilities. This function covers government electric power activities for residential, commercial, and industrial electrical usage.  Includes: Generating stations; power plants; transmission lines; switching stations; pollution abatement equipment; purchase of electricity for resale; distribution lines and meters.

children.name: Gas Utilities
children.definition: Operation, maintenance, and construction of public natural gas supply systems, including production, acquisition, and distribution of gas to general public or to other public or private utilities. This function covers government gas supply activities for residential, commercial, and industrial gas usage. Includes: Public gas works; liquefaction equipment; pumping stations; gas mains; service lines and meters; purchase of natural gas for resale.

children.name: Current Operations
children.definition: Direct expenditure for compensation of own officers and employees and for supplies, materials, and contractual services except amounts for capital outlay.

children.name: Construction
children.definition: Production of fixed works and structures additions, replacements, and major alterations, including planning and design of specific projects, site improvements, and provision of equipment and facilities that are integral parts of a structure. Includes contract construction, undertaken on a contract basis by private contractors, and force account construction, undertaken with direct use of material and labor by the government.

children.name: Other Capital Outlay
children.definition: Direct expenditure for contract or force account construction of buildings, grounds, and other improvements, and purchase of equipment, land, and existing structures. Includes amounts for additions, replacements, and major alterations to fixed works and structures. However, expenditure for repairs to such works and structures is classified as current operation expenditure.

children.name: Interests on Debt
children.definition: Amounts paid for the use of borrowed money.

children.name: Intergovernmental to State
children.definition: Amounts paid to the state government for performance of specific functions or for general financial support. Includes grants, shared taxes, contingent loans and advances, and any significant and identifiable amounts or reimbursement paid to other governments for performance of general government services or activities. By definition, it excludes amounts paid to other governments for purchase of commodities, property, or utility services and for any tax levied as such on facilities of the government.

children.name: Intergovernmental to Local
children.definition: Amounts paid to other local governments government for performance of specific functions or for general financial support. Includes grants, shared taxes, contingent loans and advances, and any significant and identifiable amounts or reimbursement paid to other governments for performance of general government services or activities. By definition, it excludes amounts paid to other governments for purchase of commodities, property, or utility services and for any tax levied as such on facilities of the government.

children.name: Water, Sewerage & Solid Waste Employment
children.source: U.S. Census Bureau - Census of Individual Governments: Employment

children.name: Total
children.definition: The number of Full-time equivalent (FTE) employees for each county is a computed statistic representing the number of full-time employees that could have been employed if the reported number of hours worked by part-time employees had been worked by full-time employees.

children.name: Total Water, Sewerage & Solid Waste
children.definition: Total Number of FTEs working on Water, Sewerage and Solid Waste Management

children.name: Sewerage
children.definition: Number of FTEs working on Provision, maintenance, and operation of sanitary and storm sewer systems and sewage disposal and treatment facilities, as well as all intergovernmental payments for such activities.

children.name: Solid Waste
children.definition: Number of FTEs working on Collection, removal, and disposal of garbage, refuse, hazardous, and other solid wastes and the cleaning of streets, alleys, and sidewalks.

children.name: Water Utilities
children.definition: Number of FTEs working on Operation, maintenance, and construction of public water supply systems, whether for distribution of water to the general public or to other public or private utilities. This function covers government water supply activities for residential, commercial, and industrial water usage.

children.name: Water, Sewerage & Solid Waste Expenditures
children.source: U.S. Census Bureau - Census of Individual Governments: Finance
companions: Total Water, Sewerage & Solid Waste Management

children.name: Total
children.definition: All amounts of money paid out by a government--net of recoveries and other correcting transactions--other than for retirement of debt, investment in securities, extension of credit, or as agency transactions. Note that expenditure includes only external transactions of a government and excludes non-cash transactions such as the provision of perquisites or other payments in kind.

children.name: Total Water, Sewerage & Solid Waste Management
children.definition: All amounts of money paid out by a government on Water, Sewerage and Solid Waste Management-net of recoveries and other correcting transactions--other than for retirement of debt, investment in securities, extension of credit, or as agency transactions. Note that expenditure includes only external transactions of a government and excludes non-cash transactions such as the provision of perquisites or other payments in kind.

children.name: Sewerage
children.definition: Provision, maintenance, and operation of sanitary and storm sewer systems and sewage disposal and treatment facilities, as well as all intergovernmental payments for such activities. Includes: Expenditures for the construction and maintenance of sanitary and storm sewers and for sewage disposal, including the following: construction and maintenance of sanitary sewer lines and related lift and pump stations; sewer cleaning and flushing; sewage treatment and water pollution control plants; storm drains that are not connected with highway projects; systems for the collection and disposal of storm runoff.

children.name: Solid Waste
children.definition: Collection, removal, and disposal of garbage, refuse, hazardous, and other solid wastes and the cleaning of streets, alleys, and sidewalks.  Includes: Garbage collection; sanitary landfills; non-nuclear hazardous waste disposal sites; incinerators; pyrolysis facilities; cleanup of toxic chemical spills and dumps; collection and disposal of abandoned vehicles; resource recovery authorities, including those which co-generate electricity or gas as a by-product; recycling centers; cleaning and washing of streets; and collection and disposal of street debris and trash.

children.name: Water Utilities
children.definition: Operation, maintenance, and construction of public water supply systems, whether for distribution of water to the general public or to other public or private utilities. This function covers government water supply activities for residential, commercial, and industrial water usage. Includes: Dams and reservoirs expressly for water supply; purification and filtration plants, including desalinization plants; pumping stations; aqueducts and transmission systems; water storage tanks; purchase of water for resale; and distribution lines and meters.

children.name: Current Operations
children.definition: Direct expenditure for compensation of own officers and employees and for supplies, materials, and contractual services except amounts for capital outlay.

children.name: Construction
children.definition: Production of fixed works and structures additions, replacements, and major alterations, including planning and design of specific projects, site improvements, and provision of equipment and facilities that are integral parts of a structure. Includes contract construction, undertaken on a contract basis by private contractors, and force account construction, undertaken with direct use of material and labor by the government.

children.name: Capital Outlay
children.definition: Direct expenditure for contract or force account construction of buildings, grounds, and other improvements, and purchase of equipment, land, and existing structures. Includes amounts for additions, replacements, and major alterations to fixed works and structures. However, expenditure for repairs to such works and structures is classified as current operation expenditure.

children.name: Interests on Debt
children.definition: Amounts paid for the use of borrowed money.

children.name: Intergovernmental to State
children.definition: Amounts paid to the state government for performance of specific functions or for general financial support. Includes grants, shared taxes, contingent loans and advances, and any significant and identifiable amounts or reimbursement paid to other governments for performance of general government services or activities. By definition, it excludes amounts paid to other governments for purchase of commodities, property, or utility services and for any tax levied as such on facilities of the government.

children.name: Intergovernmental to Local
children.definition: Amounts paid to other local governments government for performance of specific functions or for general financial support. Includes grants, shared taxes, contingent loans and advances, and any significant and identifiable amounts or reimbursement paid to other governments for performance of general government services or activities. By definition, it excludes amounts paid to other governments for purchase of commodities, property, or utility services and for any tax levied as such on facilities of the government.
